channel.title: Pulse-2-Ramp Oscillator?
channel.description:
Hello,
I’m trying to „clone“ one of my favorite reaktor ensembles with an axoloti, and at the heart of that ensemble is a „Pulse 2 Ramp“ oscillator. It’s basically a pulse osc that has slope controls inputs for both the rising and falling edge of a pulse wave, so that a pulse wave can be transformed into a triangle or saw. I couldn’t find an osc like this in the axoloti patcher. Is there maybe another way of emulating this with some clever patching? Unfortunately I can’t program my own objects.
Cheers Lars

item.title: Pulse-2-Ramp Oscillator?
item.dc:creator: @Sputnki Filippo Tamagnini
item.description:
@Sputnki wrote:

Have you tried using xfade and osc/saw + osc/pw ?

Ok, no i totally misinterpreted the question. However you can search in the libray for objects such as mtof (which outputs some number can be integrated to create a ramp, when you provide some pitch input) and filter/integrator (which is kinda like a counter)

You'll have to deal with a fair amount of logic and maths however, not sure if it's actually feasible to do with factory objects
